title: Write AI Readiness template: context questions (12)
description: Write 12 context questions: 4 demographics (company size, industry, revenue band, role), 2 pain (biggest AI frustration, what's blocking progress), 1 trigger (why looking at this now), 2 cost (hours lost to manual work, failed initiatives cost), 2 aspiration (success in 12 months, key outcome), 1 value (worth of doubled capacity).

title: Bootstrap repository + docs + Beads
description:
Outcome: Repo is ready for V1 build sprint with clean documentation scaffolding and Beads tracking.

Acceptance criteria:
- Git repo initialised on branch main
- Remote origin points at https://github.com/andy-carroll/scorekit
- Initial commit pushed
- Core docs skeleton present under docs/
- Beads initialised and BEADS_REFERENCE.md present

References:
- docs/00-overview/CONTEXT.md
- docs/05-open-source/ROADMAP.md

title: Implement share card generation + Web Share API
description: Generate OG image / share card: overall score, band, key insight, pillar mini-chart, template branding. Use @vercel/og or canvas. Implement Web Share API for mobile sharing. Fallback to copy-link for desktop. Track share events.

title: Email gate + report access token model
description:
Outcome: Email capture unlocks the report and creates a stable, shareable report link.

Acceptance criteria:
- Email is required to unlock report
- Report link uses tokenised access (not raw IDs)
- Report can be re-opened via emailed link
- Failure states are clear (invalid/expired token)

References:
- docs/03-engineering/API-SPEC.md
- docs/03-engineering/SECURITY.md

title: Polish UI - remove AI-cookie-cutter look
description: Apply brand guidelines, custom typography, refined spacing, and distinctive visual identity to avoid generic AI template appearance.

title: Build report data generator (full business case structure)
description: Implement generateReport(response, template): returns ReportData with all sections from PRD 6.2: openingInsight, yourContext, whatYouToldUs (pain quotes), costOfCurrentState, diagnosis (pillar narratives), patternsNoticed, whatYouveTried, biggestConstraint, transformationValue, singlePriority, roadmap, businessCase. This is the canonical report contract.

title: Define Template schema with pillars, recommendations, copy
description: Create Template interface: id, version, name, pillars[], questions[], recommendations[], bands[], pillarWeights?, copy{landing, report}. Pillar has id, name, description, subDimensions?. Recommendation has pillarId, scoreRange, headline, bodyTemplate, actions[], ifTriedBefore?.

title: Scaffold apps/web (Next.js) for V1 thin-slice
description:
Outcome: A runnable web app that supports a timed build-effort sprint with a minimal end-to-end flow.

Acceptance criteria:
- apps/web exists and runs locally
- Includes a minimal multi-step assessment (3–5 questions)
- Can capture answers in client state
- Has a final step that shows a placeholder report page
- No deep research in V1

References:
- docs/00-overview/NOW.md
- docs/03-engineering/ARCHITECTURE.md
- docs/05-open-source/ROADMAP.md

title: Write AI Readiness template: diagnostic questions (30)
description: Write 30 diagnostic questions for AI Readiness template across 5 pillars (6 each): Leadership & Vision, Data & Infrastructure, People & Skills, Process & Operations, Culture & Experimentation. Mix question types per pillar: 2 maturity, 2 frequency, 1 capability/history, 1 specificity. Each question has id, text, pillarId, questionType, options with value + label.

title: Write AI Readiness template: landing + report copy
description: Write landing page copy: headline, subhead, value props, time estimate, trust signals, CTA. Write report copy: section headers, pillar descriptions, roadmap framework, business case framing, CTA copy. Ensure copy is premium, not generic AI slop.

title: Template: COO project/admin chaos (questions + copy v1)
description:
Outcome: COO/admin chaos template exists as a third proof of reusability.

Acceptance criteria:
- Template config + copy skeleton exists
- Minimal viable question set and recommendations mapping

References:
- docs/01-product/TEMPLATES.md

title: Build assessment flow UI (multi-step) driven by template config
description:
Outcome: The assessment UI renders questions from the template config and collects answers reliably.

Acceptance criteria:
- Multi-step UI renders question types used in V1
- Validation prevents incomplete submissions
- Progress indicator and clear navigation
- Mobile-first layout

References:
- docs/02-design/BRAND-GUIDELINES.md
- docs/03-engineering/ARCHITECTURE.md

title: Template: Recruitment agency (questions + copy v1)
description:
Outcome: Recruitment agency template exists as a second proof of reusability.

Acceptance criteria:
- Template config + copy skeleton exists
- Minimal viable question set and recommendations mapping

References:
- docs/01-product/TEMPLATES.md

title: Add lightweight test scaffold (Vitest)
description:
Outcome: A minimal unit testing setup exists without slowing development.

Acceptance criteria:
- Vitest configured for packages/core
- Example tests for scoring engine and report generator
- One command to run tests locally

References:
- docs/03-engineering/SCORING-MODEL.md
- docs/03-engineering/REPORT-CONTRACT.md

title: Build template loader and validation
description: Create loadTemplate(id) function that loads template config from JSON/YAML file. Validate required fields, question-pillar references, recommendation score ranges. Export getTemplate, validateTemplate, listTemplates.

title: Implement pillar-grouped quiz flow with section intros
description: Update quiz page to: group questions by pillar, show pillar intro card before each section, display 'Pillar X of Y' progress, show pillar completion checkmarks. Context questions can be grouped separately (e.g., 'About Your Business' section at start, 'Your Goals' at end).

title: PDF generation + email delivery (choose path + implement)
description:
Outcome: Users receive the report as a PDF via email with acceptable reliability.

Acceptance criteria:
- Decision recorded: send via GHL workflow vs send directly (Resend)
- PDF output matches report content
- User receives email within minutes of completion
- Retry path exists for transient failures

References:
- docs/03-engineering/PDF-EMAIL-DELIVERY.md

title: Share card generation + Web Share API support
description:
Outcome: Users can share their score easily (especially on mobile).

Acceptance criteria:
- Generate a PNG share card from report inputs
- Provide download button
- Provide native share via Web Share API on supported devices

References:
- docs/02-design/SHARE-CARDS.md
- docs/03-engineering/REPORT-CONTRACT.md

title: Implement pattern detection for answer contradictions
description: Create detectPatterns(answers, template): returns Pattern[]. Pattern has id, description, insight. Example: high leadership score + low budget = 'aspirational but under-resourced'. Patterns defined in template config. Used in report 'Patterns we noticed' section.

title: Add Vitest test suite for scoring + value calculation
description: Set up Vitest in packages/core or apps/web. Write tests for: calculateScores (pillar breakdown, band assignment, primary constraint), calculateValue (cost + opportunity math), detectPatterns, getRecommendations (interpolation, score range selection). Aim for >90% coverage on core logic.

title: Build enhanced report page UI (business case layout)
description: Redesign report page to render full ReportData structure: opening insight hero, context sidebar, 'what you told us' quotes, cost callout box, pillar cards with narrative, patterns section, history acknowledgment, constraint deep-dive, value projection, single priority CTA, roadmap timeline, business case summary box. Premium design, not generic.

title: Define enhanced Question interface with diagnostic + context types
description: Update Question interface to support: diagnostic types (maturity, frequency, capability, specificity, history, priority) and context types (demographics, pain, trigger, cost, aspiration, value). Add questionCategory: diagnostic|context field. Context questions don't score but appear in report.

title: Implement scoring engine (packages/core) + vitest unit tests
description:
Outcome: Deterministic scoring is implemented as a reusable library with confidence-building tests.

Acceptance criteria:
- packages/core exports a scoring function taking answers + template config
- Outputs overall score + per-pillar scores + band + primary constraint
- Unit tests cover: band thresholds, weighting, primary constraint selection
- No dependency on UI or external services

References:
- docs/03-engineering/SCORING-MODEL.md
- docs/03-engineering/REPORT-CONTRACT.md

title: Implement report JSON generator aligned to REPORT-CONTRACT
description:
Outcome: A canonical report JSON is generated from answers + scoring outputs + template copy rules.

Acceptance criteria:
- Generator returns report JSON with required identifiers
- Report JSON includes traceability fields (template_id, template_version)
- Unit tests validate schema shape and stable outputs

References:
- docs/03-engineering/REPORT-CONTRACT.md
- docs/03-engineering/API-SPEC.md

title: Build recommendation engine with context interpolation
description: Implement getRecommendations(scores, answers, template): returns Recommendation[] for each pillar. Select recommendation by score range. Interpolate {{placeholders}} in body_template with actual values (score, pain_quote, company_size, estimated_cost). Include ifTriedBefore text when history answer indicates prior attempts.

title: Implement QuestionCard variants for all question types
description: Extend QuestionCard to render: maturity (scenario descriptions), frequency (never→always scale), capability (confidence scale), specificity (yes/no/partial), history (tried before), priority (A vs B choice), demographics (select/number), pain (multi-select or text), trigger (select), cost (number/range input), aspiration (text), value (number input). All share consistent styling.

title: Build value calculation engine (cost + opportunity)
description: Implement calculateValue(answers, template): returns {annualCost, potentialValue, roi}. Uses context answers (hours_lost, team_size, revenue_band, capacity_value) + configurable assumptions (hourly rate, weeks/year). Template can override calculation formulas. Output used in 'Cost of inaction' and 'Value of transformation' report sections.

title: Build scoring engine with pillar breakdown
description: Implement calculateScores(answers, template): returns {overall, overallBand, pillars: {[id]: {score, band, subDimensions?}}, primaryConstraint}. Only score diagnostic questions. Apply pillar weights if defined. Determine bands per pillar and overall. Primary constraint = lowest pillar.

title: Define audit template config schema + loader
description:
Outcome: Audits are configured as data (questions, scales, pillars) and can be loaded without changing application code.

Acceptance criteria:
- A documented JSON schema for template config
- A loader that reads a template by template_id + version
- Template config supports: pillars, questions, answer scales, scoring weights
- Template version is persisted with the report

References:
- docs/01-product/TEMPLATES.md
- docs/03-engineering/SCORING-MODEL.md
- docs/03-engineering/REPORT-CONTRACT.md

title: Report page UI (score, pillars, roadmap)
description:
Outcome: The on-page report feels premium and clearly explains the outputs.

Acceptance criteria:
- Displays overall score + band
- Displays pillar breakdown
- Displays primary constraint and top focus areas
- Renders a 30/60/90-day roadmap section

References:
- docs/03-engineering/REPORT-CONTRACT.md
- docs/02-design/BRAND-GUIDELINES.md

title: Template: Founder/MD AI clarity (questions + copy v1)
description:
Outcome: A complete Founder/MD template exists with 25–35 questions and report copy scaffolding.

Acceptance criteria:
- Template config includes pillars, questions, scales, scoring defaults
- Landing/report copy skeleton exists
- Maps outputs to GHL tags and nurture hooks

References:
- docs/01-product/TEMPLATES.md
- docs/01-product/POSITIONING-ONE-PAGER-TEMPLATE.md

title: Implement GHL webhook integration
description: On email gate submit: POST to GHL webhook with contact fields (email, name, company, role), assessment data (template, overall score, band, primary constraint, pillar scores), and custom fields for key context answers (pain, goals). Apply tags per PRD 9.2. Fire async, don't block report display.

title: Design system: typography, colors, spacing tokens
description: Define design tokens in Tailwind config: font family (premium serif + sans), type scale, color palette (not generic blue/purple), spacing rhythm, border radius, shadows. Create design-tokens.ts or extend tailwind.config. Goal: distinctive, premium look that doesn't scream 'AI template'.

title: GoHighLevel sync: upsert contact + tags + workflow trigger
description:
Outcome: Every completed assessment is synced into GHL for automated nurture and sales follow-up.

Acceptance criteria:
- Upsert contact by email
- Apply tags for template_id, overall_band, primary_constraint
- Trigger workflow (or equivalent)
- Report renders even if GHL fails (retry later)

References:
- docs/03-engineering/GHL-INTEGRATION.md

title: Write AI Readiness template: recommendations + patterns
description: Write recommendations for each pillar at each band level (Starting/Emerging/Progressing/Leading). Include body_template with {{placeholders}}, actions[], ifTriedBefore text. Define 5-8 patterns for contradiction detection (e.g., high-leadership-low-budget, good-data-poor-skills). Write opening insight templates per band.

title: Implement PDF report generation
description: Generate PDF from ReportData. Options: react-pdf, puppeteer/playwright screenshot, or external service. PDF should match web report design. Include share card as first page. Trigger async after email gate. Store PDF URL for email delivery.
